channel.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
channel.description:
Any resemblance of this thread to any other is strictly coincidental, and psychiatric help should be sought. Any way, post them here. Mine is Mason's sledge hammer in RFG.
By the way, have you ever considered how awesome Raminator is?

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Keresh:

Off topic here, but its my thread, so deal with it. The handle thing on the gluon gun looks waaaaaay to big. That will be all.

EDIT: Oh yeah, all the scientist slaughter house weapons. Especially if you played through Half Life with them.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Soup
item.description:
GordonFreeman:

You’ll be like hydroxl groups in alcohol…

A classic choice for me, the BFG 9000.

A clean, efficient weapon with smooth operation and a wide muzzle, perfect when the stuff REALLY hits the fan. That unique charge sound, that exhilarating whine, a clear death sentence for anything within it’s sights. Exerything trembles in it’s wake…except maybe a Cyberdemon.

I was so ahead of you, it’s embarrassing.

Read full topic
item.source: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Winged One:

Then you realize if you miss, they take so long to explode.

That’s why you don’t miss.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Then you realize if you miss, they take so long to explode.

I personally like the frag grenade. On campaign, it’s usually more than enough to kill Grunts and Jackals, and at least injure Brutes, Elites, and Hunters.

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Soup
item.description:
Comrade Tiki:

And a 60% chance one of you gets killed from afar before either shotgun or energy sword has won.
That always seemed to happen in HLDM when it came to spontaneous crowbar-fights.

Both weapons deliver 1-hit kills, Mr. Luddite.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Winged One:

Meh.

I thought it was cool. Until I realized how easy to counter with a shotgun it was.

I bet 60% of the time I would kill you every time with the energy sword.

Read full topic
item.source: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
raw_bean:

Many would say that was Return of the Jedi, with the Ewoks. But as someone whose older brother was just the right age (seven) when the very first one came out - and I’ve seen his original 1978 Star Wars Annual and the toy Millennium Falcon he dreamed of owning - I’d argue that it was right from the very start.

Well of course.

I meant when Lucas started to get blatantly intentional with the characters and movies themselves.

LEGO Star Wars is probably the best result this had. Shame the contract runs out in two years though.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite Video Game Weapon (No Gravity Gun)
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
I don’t think RC has enough ultra-violence or questionable material to be rated M.

there’s no child molesters or people that say “Fuck” or drugs in Star Wars. Plus, it was made around the time Lucas started making the franchise appeal to kids with the release of episode 3 and that fucking awesome cartoon.

Read full topic
